Sessions.Title: Globally distributed computing for pennies
Sessions.Room: Using Azure serverless functions, Event Grid, CQRS and event sourcing to build an extremely low cost system that scales to meet demand.

Speaker.Name: Duncan Jones
Speaker.Description: Duncan is a developer in the Financial Services industry based in Dublin, with an interest in DDD and CQRS/ES - he has developed a DSL plug in for creating event sourcing systems in Visual Studio and is the organiser of the Dublin Software Craftsmanship meetup.

Sessions.Title: Azure DevOps from rookie to DevStar
Sessions.Room: In this session we will cover all the components of Azure DevOps in order to deploy an application to Azure environment using ACS or AKS.

Speaker.Name: Angel M Rayo
Speaker.Description: MCT since 2005, MCSE Cloud, ITIL Expert and more than 10500 hours of training experience in several companies and events like MCT Global Summit, SQL Saturday, SharePoint Day, i.e.

Sessions.Title: CosmosDB in the real world
Sessions.Room: As a C# developer, I built a Cosmosdb backend for a global real-time platform, working with Microsoft. I'll introduce Cosmosdb, and why you might want to use it instead of other Azure Data options, and I'll talk about some of the pitfalls I discovered, and upcoming/recent changes that Microsoft have made.

Speaker.Name: Craig Nicol
Speaker.Organization: Technical Architect at Screenmedia Design Ltd
Speaker.Description: .Net/web developer with 15 years experience, mostly backend and data. Currently a technical architect at Microsoft Gold Partner, Screenmedia. I have worked in products and consulting for many clients, mainly on the web. My main interests are data security and performance.

Sessions.Title: Building mostly serverless distributed cloud systems step by step
Sessions.Room: Serverless is definitely here to stay, and there are also more and more frameworks meant to ease serverless containers and functions development (even across clouds) becoming stable every day. Although the idea behind serverless is not to worry about the infrastructure, you still need to worry about how long will it take to scale, and that's where things like cold starts, preheating, multiple deployments, and hybrid environments come into play. Basically, serverless is a great tool when used where needed, and that's the topic of this talk - learn how to build a serverless system, talk about some caveats, and discuss alternatives.

Speaker.Name: Ivan Culjak
Speaker.Description: Ivan is a .NET freelance developer in love with Azure, Xamarin, and the idea of automating whatever. When he’s not developing something new, he’s salvaging something inherited, consulting with enthusiasm, and testing and breaking new technologies in a quest for something useful.

Sessions.Title: Office365 Migrations in the tens of thousands
Sessions.Room: This session will describe challenges (and solutions) migrating large organisations to office365. The goal is to spend time looking at areas which don’t attract much attention in typical articles and is based on years of lessons learnt the hard way. Topics covered include Azure AD, Conditional Access, Email and using office365 as the base to integrate merging companies.

Speaker.Name: Colin Chaplin
Speaker.Description: Colin is a freelance IT consultant with over 20 years experience in end user computing, especially Exchange, Office365 and Windows 10. He has spoke at Microsoft TechReady and written for the Microsoft Technet UK blog and Practical365.co

Sessions.Title: Logging, instrumentation, dashboards, alerts and all that - for developers.
Sessions.Room: Embracing DevOps entails more than just shipping changes to production faster and faster. Your team is suddenly also responsible for monitoring your software in production and detecting and troubleshooting issues. To work together with operation specialists in your team or maybe even embrace a #NoOps approach, you as the developer, need to learn about monitoring.

Speaker.Name: Henry Been - Microsoft MVP
Speaker.Description: Henry Been is an independent architect and developer from The Netherlands. He enjoys working with software development teams to create and deliver great software. His interests include the Azure cloud, Agile, DevOps, software architecture and the design and implementation of testable and maintainable software.
